a:prop.e:textdescription:
Hi All,
The EcomExtracts DB I used is a local copy in my system now.
I had used the ctsqldev2000.EcomExtracts for testing before. Could we build the new table and stored procedure in this database?
We also need to create the usp_SelectCustCodeDetailByItemNbrAndCompanyCode in this database. It has been created in my local database.
About the “d)The shipping ask confirmation files of the Ecometry, I think these orders in the files should be also in the PZM database”, I will explain:
The Shipping Confirmation files should be created from Ecometry.
The 431 service will create the ShpAck xml based on these files.
But there are not enough data in these files.
We need to get the completed data from PZM database, then update some fields by the Shipping Confirmation files of Ecometry.
The detail steps are:
Get the Shipping Confirmation files from a special shared folder.
Get the order ID from the Shipping Confirmation file.
Call CommonDataAccess.GetICSMOrderByOrderId() to get the IcsmOrder by the order Id.
Call CommonDataAccess.GetLineItemsByOrderNumber() to get the LineItems.
Call ICSMShipAck() to create the ShpAck by the IcsmOrder and LineItems.
Update the ShipNoticeRequest by the data in Shipping Confirmation files.
Create and drop the ShpAck xml to special folder.
Because the service need some order data to create the ShpAck, so these orders should be in PZM Database.
Or we can fix the Shipping Confirmation files by the existing order information in PZM Database.
About the 123Print PO and LV PO:
The service is coding base on the formatting of LV PO.
The LV PO and 123Print PO should be same formatting, but we still worry there are different between the 123Print and LV.
So we need some 123Print PO to analyze and compare with the LV PO.
Best Regards,
Ding Li
From: Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect) Sent: Tuesday, September 10, 2013 5:51 To: Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect); Morris, Kimbrough S (PaperDirect); Lewis, Larry M (Current); Ding, Li (Northern Lights); Welch, Mike J (Current); Wang, Bai Kang (Northern Lights) Cc: Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect); Zhang, Daniel (Current) Subject: RE: CMFG-431 / Universal converter concern

Questions/open issues -
1) Confirm whether the two items below were in the BRD or not. – Larry
2) Decide if they are critical – Larry, Kimbrough, Mike
3) Database
a. Provide the DB schema – Li
b. Or provide information for Kimbrough to create the tables and stored procedures - Li
4) Create jira sub tasks for what needs changed –Larry
I have asked Mike to include Kimbrough in the PZM scrum call 9/10/13 to talk through these questions.
From: Morris, Kimbrough S (PaperDirect) Sent: Thursday, September 05, 2013 8:45 AM To: Zhang, Daniel (Current); Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect); Lewis, Larry M (Current) Cc: Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect) Subject: CMFG-431 / Universal converter concern
Daniel / Lisa / Larry,
I'm a little concerned by the two emails from Li last night. It sounds like he still doesn't quite understand what we've asked for. I don't think I read the final BRD that was given to Li, but based on the discussions I had with Larry, I think there's a disconnect somewhere.
In this first one, there's no database lookup table, he put it in the app.config. And he's asking me for the name of the sproc, which means he thinks I'm doing the database work. I thought he was.
Hi Kimbrough,
I had set these values in the app.config now. They are the properties of the base processor. The controller will get them from app.config and set to the processor object when creating the processor instance. Would you please provide the stored procedure name for lookup them? I will fix the code to get them from DB. This can reduce the number of configuration items.
Best Regards, Ding Li
I had asked him for the database tables he's built so far, but he didn't respond to that question. Based on the above comment, I don't know if he's built the table to hold the order data or not.
Larry and I were discussing the database side of this, and would like you to provide the schema you've developed so far so that we can review it.
--Kimbrough
In the second email, he's still referencing the PZM database. I've attempted previously to explain that PZM has nothing to do with this converter program. He's also talking about the difference between the 123Print PO and the LV PO. The LV PO will never go through this program, as that's Ecometry's output. I'm worried that he's coded for a file that he'll never see, and that file had lots of special stuff in it. And again, he's asking that we provide the Source Code lookup table. I added the a), b) etc to the things he listed. a & c we do need to set up. b I can do, I just need to know I need to do it. For d, if we drop everything after the comma, I think he's asking for a sample ship confirmation file from Andrew / Ecometry.
Hi All,
Thanks for Andrew and Danielle’s help. I had imported the ICSM PO into the Ecometry successfully.
For whole service, there may be some small problems what can be fix by changing configuration or little code changing.
For doing the integration <app:ds:integration> testing <app:ds:testing> , please provide these assistant data to me when they are ready. For example: a)The CustCodeDetail data of the testing items in the T_Data_ItemMaster and T_Data_CustCodeDetail table, these testing items should exist in Ecometry. b)The relation table of the ICSMID, SourceCode, Company and Division. c)The style converting data in the IcsmCodes Web service. d)The shipping ask confirmation files of the Ecometry, I think these orders in the files should be also in the PZM database.
In addition <app:ds:addition> , is there any different or special logic between the 123Print processor and the universal processor of CMFG-431? I think we also need some real PO xmls of 123print to research and confirm the different formatting between 123print PO and LV PO.
Best Regards, Ding Li
Let me know what's decided on the database tasks, if I need to do it or he will. But I need to see any database stuff he has developed so that it can be reviewed and adjusted if necessary.
--Kimbrough

Daniel / Lisa / Larry,

 

I'm a little concerned by the two emails from Li last night.  It sounds like he still doesn't quite understand what we've asked for.  I don't think I read the final BRD that was given to Li, but based on the discussions I had with Larry, I think there's a disconnect somewhere. 

 

 

In this first one, there's no database lookup table, he put it in the app.config.  And he's asking me for the name of the sproc, which means he thinks I'm doing the database work.  I thought he was.

Hi Kimbrough,

 

I had set these values in the app.config now.
They are the properties of the base processor.
The controller will get them from app.config and set to the processor object when creating the processor instance.
Would you please provide the stored procedure name for lookup them?
I will fix the code to get them from DB. This can reduce the number of configuration items.

Best Regards,
Ding Li

 

I had asked him for the database tables he's built so far, but he didn't respond to that question.  Based on the above comment, I don't know if he's built the table to hold the order data or not.

Larry and I were discussing the database side of this, and would like you to provide the schema you've developed so far so that we can review it.

--Kimbrough

 

In the second email, he's still referencing the PZM database.  I've attempted previously to explain that PZM has nothing to do with this converter program.  He's also talking about the difference between the 123Print PO and the LV PO.  The LV PO will never go through this program, as that's Ecometry's output.  I'm worried that he's coded for a file that he'll never see, and that file had lots of special stuff in it.  And again, he's asking that we provide the Source Code lookup table.  I added the a), b) etc to the things he listed.  a & c we do need to set up.  b I can do, I just need to know I need to do it.  For d, if we drop everything after the comma, I think he's asking for a sample ship confirmation file from Andrew / Ecometry.

Hi All,

Thanks for Andrew and Danielle’s help. I had imported the ICSM PO into the Ecometry successfully.

For whole service, there may be some small problems what can be fix by changing configuration or little code changing.

For doing the integration testing, please provide these assistant data to me when they are ready.
For example:
a)The CustCodeDetail data of the testing items in the T_Data_ItemMaster and T_Data_CustCodeDetail table, these testing items should exist in Ecometry.
b)The relation table of the  ICSMID, SourceCode, Company and Division.
c)The style converting data in the IcsmCodes Web service.
d)The shipping ask confirmation files of the Ecometry, I think these orders in the files should be also in the PZM database.

In addition, is there any different or special logic between the 123Print processor and the universal processor of CMFG-431?
I think we also need some real PO xmls of 123print to research and confirm the different formatting between 123print PO and LV PO.

 

Best Regards,
Ding Li

 

Let me know what's decided on the database tasks, if I need to do it or he will.  But I need to see any database stuff he has developed so that it can be reviewed and adjusted if necessary.

--Kimbrough

Actually I'm not sure LV orders would be a good substitute for Taymark orders.  There would be differences such as textID = Font vs typestyle attribute, and who knows what else based on the fact that the xml is produced by different programs at different companies.  Plus the LV to 111A xmls have a lot of custom code to handle pick tickets in PZM.

 

We really need Taymark to provide some samples of what their xmls look like.

                                                                     

I also need to know what products they'll be sending, what options exist on those products, and what ICSM values they are using for those options so that I can set up the ICSMCode website.  Until there is real data out there, Li won't be able to successfully process anything.

 

In addition to the product data, what ship methods are we honoring?  Is there going to be a default, standard shipping that would go to 07 for Ecometry to determine the best method, then we only honor the Express methods, or do we take UPS Ground as UPS Ground, etc?

 

I still need a jira for setting up the ICSMCodes data.  Please provide the number to me and the priority / deadline.

 

--Kimbrough

Hi Andrew,

 

I had tried to test several kinds of order.

 

Because my mock order is based on LV order, I guessed for the LV order, these fields should be:

<COMPANY>01</COMPANY>

<DIVISION>20</DIVISION>

<R10_SOURCE>1MD2ZEB2</R10_SOURCE>

The ”1MD2ZEB2” is the sourceCode in the LV PO xml. ( The attribute of the <PartnerItemDetail> node.)

I got the response “<REJECT_REASON>Invalid Offer</REJECT_REASON>”.

 

I think this should be caused there aren’t this source code in Ecometry, so next I tested with the RAL order:

<COMPANY>04</COMPANY>

<DIVISION>51</DIVISION>

<R10_SOURCE>AINET</R10_SOURCE>

I got the response “<REJECT_REASON>Invalid Pay Method</REJECT_REASON>”

 

But I didn’t find the payment information in the LV PO xml.

When I added a credit card information to the request, it’s successful.

 

Would you please help me to confirm these questions:

1.       Are the COMPANY=01, DIVISION=20 correct for LV?[Hettinger, Andrew J (PaperDirect)]  This is correct for LV. However, we need these need to go into the Current Fulfillment company and division. The company is 03 and division is 04.

 

2.       I think the next task I should converter the 123print order, how to set the COMPANY and DIVISION node for this site?[Hettinger, Andrew J (PaperDirect)]  The company is 03 and division is 04.

 

3.       For RAL, the AINET and BINET are used for default source code. If we need the default source for 123print site?[Hettinger, Andrew J (PaperDirect)]  Danielle, can you set up default source code for this company and division?

 

4.       If there are not payment information in the PO xml (Credit Card Type, Credit Card Number etc ), how to set the <R10_PAY_METHOD> node?[Hettinger, Andrew J (PaperDirect)]  Please pass PX as the pay method.

 

5.       Does the item number of LV (or 123print) can be passed by Ecometry?[Hettinger, Andrew J (PaperDirect)]  You are correct, the items listed below are tied to RAL and can’t be used for the 123 Print Orders. Danielle can you set up a few test items for Current Fulfillment division?

I used the LV item “500031829000250”, it can’t be passed. But I think it may be caused by I use the RAL source code.

When I changed the item number to “510031485000500”(It’s got from RAL order), the order is passed successfully.

 

Best Regards,

Ding Li

Actually I'm not sure LV orders would be a good substitute for Taymark orders.  There would be differences such as textID = Font vs typestyle attribute, and who knows what else based on the fact that the xml is produced by different programs at different companies.  Plus the LV to 111A xmls have a lot of custom code to handle pick tickets in PZM.

 

We really need Taymark to provide some samples of what their xmls look like.

                                                                     

I also need to know what products they'll be sending, what options exist on those products, and what ICSM values they are using for those options so that I can set up the ICSMCode website.  Until there is real data out there, Li won't be able to successfully process anything.

 

In addition to the product data, what ship methods are we honoring?  Is there going to be a default, standard shipping that would go to 07 for Ecometry to determine the best method, then we only honor the Express methods, or do we take UPS Ground as UPS Ground, etc?

 

I still need a jira for setting up the ICSMCodes data.  Please provide the number to me and the priority / deadline.

 

--Kimbrough

a:prop.e:textdescription:
I checked the ShippingValues table this morning, only 21 rows, all SE/CI. 1 from April by the Sorter, 11 from Aug (2 by the Sorter, others are merge force ships), the rest are reboxes from this month.
The original CMFG-1091 changes did meet the requirements, but the requirements were not complete. The problem the ticket was trying to address was sending ShipAcks that did not have any items in the ShipNoticePortion block, which describes what is in the box. The ShipNoticePortion block did have data, included the box # (required for Alliance), but the quantity and product code were not included. Since the Alliance OrderStore process only ships the first box # in the ShipAck, this was still a valid ShipAck for the box. Ecometry ships by the level/PZM OrderID, so those were not affected either. I do not believe this condition caused problems since the box/level was still being shipped.
http://ctdevsource:8080/browse/CMFG-1157 added, marked as Blocker, assigned to me. We will need to discuss this on Monday to see if this condition really is a problem or not. If it is a problem that needs to be addressed, we’ll need to decide on how it should be done. If we need to include each PickItem, I will definitely need Kimbrough’s help with changing the OrderManager.GetShippingData stored procedure.
Mike Welch
From: Welch, Mike J (Current) Sent: Friday, September 06, 2013 7:53 PM To: Morris, Kimbrough S (PaperDirect) Cc: Oulton, Nancy J (Current); Heck, Kirby R (Current); Lewis, Larry M (Current); Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect); Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect) Subject: RE: Please review - Possible issue with new Shipinator
OK, found it. The problem was masked by my queries since it was looking for everything for an order needed to be in ReadyToShip status, and counts were similar to daily counts in the past.
The problem is in Shipinator, from the change for CMFG-1091. That Jira was supposed to prevent the reboxes being sent to Alliance and empty box shipacks from being created. The code that checked for empty boxes was looking at the wrong field and skipped the boxes without lineitems.
Considering the severity and visibility, I’ve made the change to my Shipinator, am processing everything now. Once this is done with the current batch, I’ll let the regular Shipinator continue to process over the weekend.
Larry, we will need to go over the requirements for CMFG-1091 to find an alternate process to prevent the empty box shipacks. From what I recall, this condition was very rare. There is another change in Shipinator for CMFG-39\1145, this could be included in that QA cycle.
Mike Welch
From: Morris, Kimbrough S (PaperDirect) Sent: Friday, September 06, 2013 5:05 PM To: Welch, Mike J (Current) Cc: Oulton, Nancy J (Current); Heck, Kirby R (Current); Lewis, Larry M (Current); Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect); Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect) Subject: Please review - Possible issue with new Shipinator Importance: High
Mike,
I was helping Nancy review the low shipment counts in Alliance since she discovered that since the new shipinator was deployed on 9/4/13, there have been ZERO F boxes shipped in Alliance. 9/3/13 had a normal amount of shipments. We found that in PZM, the [OrderManager].[GetShippingData] stored procedure is returning 8889 records, with ship dates going back to the early morning of 9/4/13. The majority appear to be SE and CI, but there are aging CL and LV in there as well.
Can you please look into why the program is not processing all of the records coming back from the sproc?
Thanks,
Kimbrough

a:prop.e:htmldescription:
I checked the ShippingValues table this morning, only 21 rows, all SE/CI.  1 from April by the Sorter, 11 from Aug (2 by the Sorter, others are merge force ships),  the rest are reboxes from this month.

 

The original CMFG-1091 changes did meet the requirements, but the requirements were not complete.  The problem the ticket was trying to address was sending ShipAcks that did not have any items in the ShipNoticePortion block, which describes what is in the box.  The ShipNoticePortion block did have data, included the box # (required for Alliance), but the quantity and product code were not included.  Since the Alliance OrderStore process only ships the first box # in the ShipAck, this was still a valid ShipAck for the box.  Ecometry ships by the level/PZM OrderID, so those were not affected either.  I do not believe this condition caused problems since the box/level was still being shipped. 

 

http://ctdevsource:8080/browse/CMFG-1157 added, marked as Blocker, assigned to me.   We will need to discuss this on Monday to see if this condition really is a problem or not.  If it is a problem that needs to be addressed, we’ll need to decide on how it should be done.  If we need to include each PickItem, I will definitely need Kimbrough’s help with changing the OrderManager.GetShippingData stored procedure.

 

Mike Welch

 

From: Welch, Mike J (Current)
Sent: Friday, September 06, 2013 7:53 PM
To: Morris, Kimbrough S (PaperDirect)
Cc: Oulton, Nancy J (Current); Heck, Kirby R (Current); Lewis, Larry M (Current); Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect); Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect)
Subject: RE: Please review - Possible issue with new Shipinator

 

OK, found it.  The problem was masked by my queries since it was looking for everything for an order needed to be in ReadyToShip status, and counts were similar to daily counts in the past.

The problem is in Shipinator, from the change for CMFG-1091.  That Jira was supposed to prevent the reboxes being sent to Alliance and empty box shipacks from being created.  The code that checked for empty boxes was looking at the wrong field and skipped the boxes without lineitems.

 

Considering the severity and visibility, I’ve made the change to my Shipinator, am processing everything now. Once this is done with the current batch, I’ll let the regular Shipinator continue to process over the weekend.

 

Larry, we will need to go over the requirements for CMFG-1091 to find an alternate process to prevent the empty box shipacks.  From what I recall, this condition was very rare. There is another change in Shipinator for CMFG-39\1145, this could be included in that QA cycle.

 

Mike Welch

 

From: Morris, Kimbrough S (PaperDirect)
Sent: Friday, September 06, 2013 5:05 PM
To: Welch, Mike J (Current)
Cc: Oulton, Nancy J (Current); Heck, Kirby R (Current); Lewis, Larry M (Current); Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect); Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect)
Subject: Please review - Possible issue with new Shipinator
Importance: High

 

Mike,

    I was helping Nancy review the low shipment counts in Alliance since she discovered that since the new shipinator was deployed on 9/4/13, there have been ZERO F boxes shipped in Alliance.  9/3/13 had a normal amount of shipments.  We found that in PZM, the [OrderManager].[GetShippingData] stored procedure is returning 8889 records, with ship dates going back to the early morning of 9/4/13.  The majority appear to be SE and CI, but there are aging CL and LV in there as well.

 

    Can you please look into why the program is not processing all of the records coming back from the sproc?

 

Thanks,

Kimbrough

a:prop.e:textdescription:
Baker,
I think everything is ready for you. I made changes to the Shipinator project and PZMOrderConverter. Make sure you get the latest from SVN.
For Shipinator:
PZMData\Classes\OrderManager\ShippingValues.cs
Shipinator\ShipAckCreatorProcessur.cs
I ran across a few problems with the PZMOrderConverter.
If there are more than 1 set of Deluxe CTL\EDI files it will merge the orders. In production, they only send one set a day, so that is not a real big problem, we just need to watch out after deploy if we have to resubmit files to make sure there is only one set at a time. I did not do any research on how to fix this.
The CU import failed to load a few of the test files. Some of the files have a null char on the last line, which the import processor tried to treat as the trailer line. I updated ChecksUnlimitedImportProcessor.cs to handle it a little better.
I fixed the PR->SAF conversion code in ICSMPurchaseOrder.cs, the comparison included leading/trailing spaces.
I imported about ICSM XML files created by the PZMOrderConverter into DEV. No errors or import failures.
Test ShipAcks are in {NL FTP}\DeluxeFolder\PZMShipAcks. There are about 125 ready for testing. The ShipNoticePortion has the CustomerNumber and OrderDate in Comments:
<ShipNoticePortion>
<OrderReference orderID="96681680" />
<Comments type="CustomerNumber">242545037</Comments>
<Comments type="OrderDate">2013-04-25</Comments>
This is how I forced the ShipAcks:
select *
--update sv
--set ReadyToProcess = 1, ShipDate = getdate(), ModifiedById = 42, ShippingSource = 'ShipAckTest'
from OrderManager.ICSMPurchaseOrder ipo
inner join OrderManager.ShippingValues sv on ipo.ICSMPurchaseOrderId = sv.ICSMPurchaseOrderId
where ipo.ModifiedDate > '2013-09-06 14:00' -- date I started importing DLX and CU files
-- or use ipo.FromIdentity = 'DLXC' or 'CUN'
exec OrderManager.GetShippingData
Those are now being added to all ShipAcks if PZM has the data. If you don’t see those nodes, exec OrderManager.GetShippingData and you should have those two columns at the end of the row. If they aren’t there, run the {PZM SVN}\Database\Ordermanager.GetShippingData.sql.
We will still need to run tests using the service code, which waits for specific times to run the different processors. Would it be better to run this as a scheduled job?
Mike Welch

a:prop.e:htmldescription:
Baker,

  I think everything is ready for you.  I made changes to the Shipinator project and PZMOrderConverter.  Make sure you get the latest from SVN.

 

For Shipinator:

PZMData\Classes\OrderManager\ShippingValues.cs

Shipinator\ShipAckCreatorProcessur.cs

 

I ran across a few problems with the PZMOrderConverter. 

If there are more than 1 set of Deluxe CTL\EDI files it will merge the orders.  In production, they only send one set a day, so that is not a real big problem, we just need to watch out after deploy if we have to resubmit files to make sure there is only one set at a time.  I did not do any research on how to fix this.

The CU import failed to load a few of the test files.  Some of the files have a null char on the last line, which the import processor tried to treat as the trailer line.  I updated ChecksUnlimitedImportProcessor.cs to handle it a little better.

I fixed the PR->SAF conversion code in ICSMPurchaseOrder.cs, the comparison included leading/trailing spaces.

 

I imported about ICSM XML files created by the PZMOrderConverter into DEV.  No errors or import failures.

 

Test ShipAcks are in {NL FTP}\DeluxeFolder\PZMShipAcks.  There are about 125 ready for testing.  The ShipNoticePortion has the CustomerNumber and OrderDate in Comments:

 

<ShipNoticePortion>

        <OrderReference orderID="96681680" />

        <Comments type="CustomerNumber">242545037</Comments>

        <Comments type="OrderDate">2013-04-25</Comments>

 

This is how I forced the ShipAcks:

select *

--update sv

--set ReadyToProcess = 1, ShipDate = getdate(), ModifiedById = 42, ShippingSource = 'ShipAckTest'

      from OrderManager.ICSMPurchaseOrder ipo

      inner join OrderManager.ShippingValues sv on ipo.ICSMPurchaseOrderId = sv.ICSMPurchaseOrderId

      where ipo.ModifiedDate > '2013-09-06 14:00' -- date I started importing DLX and CU files

      -- or use ipo.FromIdentity = 'DLXC' or 'CUN'

 

exec OrderManager.GetShippingData

 

Those are now being added to all ShipAcks if PZM has the data.  If you don’t see those nodes, exec OrderManager.GetShippingData and you should have those two columns at the end of the row.  If they aren’t there, run the {PZM SVN}\Database\Ordermanager.GetShippingData.sql.

 

We will still need to run tests using the service code, which waits for specific times to run the different processors.  Would it be better to run this as a scheduled job?

 

Mike Welch

OK, I just committed changes to Common, Importronic, Importronic Service and Importronic Test projects. It’s controlling whether to use the new PZMTransformer or the old process through a define at the top of ICSMOrder. The PZMTransformer class is not complete and is not being used, I think the “Transform” button on the UI form will do some of the conversion/transformation, but it’s probably a good idea to just ignore that button now.
The test SharePoint site is http://current.portal.tc.inet/exceptionstest/Exceptions/Forms/Open%20Issues.aspx, I think the ones they are talking about are the ones with “Test order” in the description. There are several from 28 Aug. I just imported two of those into Test with no problems. I’m thinking it was a bad data setup. The event log was talking about null reference when adding to the LineItemContainer.
Mike Welch

  OK, I just committed changes to Common, Importronic, Importronic Service and Importronic Test projects.    It’s controlling whether to use the new PZMTransformer or the old process through a define at the top of ICSMOrder.  The PZMTransformer class is not complete and is not being used, I think the “Transform” button on the UI form will do some of the conversion/transformation, but it’s probably a good idea to just ignore that button now.

 

The test SharePoint site is http://current.portal.tc.inet/exceptionstest/Exceptions/Forms/Open%20Issues.aspx, I think the ones they are talking about are the ones with “Test order” in the description.  There are several from 28 Aug.  I just imported two of those into Test with no problems.  I’m thinking it was a bad data setup.  The event log was talking about null reference when adding to the LineItemContainer.

 

Mike Welch

From: Wang, Bai Kang (Northern Lights) 
Sent: Friday, September 06, 2013 1:56 AM
To: Lewis, Larry M (Current)
Cc: Welch, Mike J (Current); Zhang, Daniel (Current); Cooper, Rob R (Current)
Subject: [CMFG-39] CMFG-1140: Bug - Special Character are not escaped



Hi Larry,



After investigation, I think it’s not escape problem. It should be reading in wrong encoding character set.

The valid character set of XML supports special characters like trade registered mark without any escape, and <,>, &, ‘,” can be automatically escaped by .Net framework when serializing an object to xml string.

So for escape problem, it had been implemented and not need any code changes. (I had rollback all changes I made for this)

Here is a sample program,



    [XmlRoot]

    public class ClassA

    {

        public AttributeA AttrA { get; set; }



        public ClassA()

        {

            AttrA=new AttributeA();

        }

    }



    public class AttributeA

    {

        [XmlAttribute]

        public string Name { get; set; }

        public string Value { get; set; }

    }



        [Test]

        public void EscapeXML()

        {

            ClassA a=new ClassA();

            a.AttrA.Name = "\" \"\"\"Test\"\"\" \"";

            a.AttrA.Value = "<'A'> <=> <'B'> & & &<\"C\">";

            string actual = string.Empty;

            XmlSerializer s=new XmlSerializer(typeof(ClassA));

            using (MemoryStream ms=new MemoryStream())

            {

                s.Serialize(ms,a);

                ms.Position = 0;

                byte[] buffer=new byte[ms.Length];

                ms.Read(buffer, 0, buffer.Length);

                actual = Encoding.Default.GetString(buffer);

            }



            Console.WriteLine(actual);

        }



actual:

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<ClassA xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

  <AttrA Name="" """Test""" "">

    <Value><'A'> <=> <'B'> & & &<"C"></Value>

  </AttrA>

</ClassA>



I suppose it should be reading in wrong encoding character set. I tried to detect EDI and CTL text file encoding code, it’s not UTF-8 or Unicode. But Converter program used system default encoding code to parse the input text file, so some characters were parsed incorrect from input text file binary stream.

We need the original text file encoding code.



Thanks,

Baker Wang

Subject: [CMFG-39] CMFG-1140: Bug - Special Character are not escaped

 

Hi Larry,

 

After investigation, I think it’s not escape problem. It should be reading in wrong encoding character set.

The valid character set of XML supports special characters like trade registered mark without any escape, and <,>, &, ‘,” can be automatically escaped by .Net framework when serializing an object to xml string.

So for escape problem, it had been implemented and not need any code changes. (I had rollback all changes I made for this)

Here is a sample program,

 

    [XmlRoot]

    public class ClassA

    {

        public AttributeA AttrA { get; set; }

 

        public ClassA()

        {

            AttrA=new AttributeA();

        }

    }

 

    public class AttributeA

    {

        [XmlAttribute]

        public string Name { get; set; }

        public string Value { get; set; }

    }

 

        [Test]

        public void EscapeXML()

        {

            ClassA a=new ClassA();

            a.AttrA.Name = "\" \"\"\"Test\"\"\" \"";

            a.AttrA.Value = "<'A'> <=> <'B'> & & &<\"C\">";

            string actual = string.Empty;

            XmlSerializer s=new XmlSerializer(typeof(ClassA));

            using (MemoryStream ms=new MemoryStream())

            {

                s.Serialize(ms,a);

                ms.Position = 0;

                byte[] buffer=new byte[ms.Length];

                ms.Read(buffer, 0, buffer.Length);

                actual = Encoding.Default.GetString(buffer);

            }

 

            Console.WriteLine(actual);

        }

 

actual:

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<ClassA xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

  <AttrA Name="" """Test""" "">

    <Value><'A'> <=> <'B'> & & &<"C"></Value>

  </AttrA>

</ClassA>

 

I suppose it should be reading in wrong encoding character set. I tried to detect EDI and CTL text file encoding code, it’s not UTF-8 or Unicode. But Converter program used system default encoding code to parse the input text file, so some characters were parsed incorrect from input text file binary stream.

We need the original text file encoding code.

 

Thanks,

Baker Wang

Hi Daniel,
I have fixed 4 but can’t reproduce CMFG-1145 and CMFG-1141.
CMFG-1145:
According to original “Checks Ship Status Record Format” I can’t reproduce, refer to the attachment. If there are changes please provide me latest one.
CMFG-1141:
Talked with Li, this bug is out of Converter program control. The Exception message will be sent by PZM system, if there is no error message in Exception, it maybe something happened in PZM system. So to reproduce it I need test data or test environment (where occurs error) and go through PZM process.
Thanks,
Baker Wang

a:prop.d:subject: RE: Deluxe Envelopes - CMFG-39 and subtasks
a:prop.e:htmldescription:
Good morning Baker,

You are correct about CMFG-1141, that error belongs to the Importronic.

CMFG-1145 is a problem with the format of the output record please review the ShipStatus Record tab.

·         Issues
• Created an empty file with only the header and trailer When I ran the Job there was an empty file created
• Checks Unlimited confirmation file format errors
○ Missing the Customer number from the input file pos 3-11
○ Order date is ship date in record from the input file pos 20-27
○ Accessories Line Number from the input file pos 631-633
○ Product code is ours must be theirs
○ Record length is incorrect two positions too long

 

 

Please compare the output from the se_status201308061207p.txt file which is produced now to the new file from the converter se_status201308291115A.txt

 

 

v/r

 

Larry Lewis

Business Analyst

719-531-2509 office

719-237-4758 cell

 

From: Wang, Bai Kang (Northern Lights)
Sent: Thursday, September 05, 2013 9:24 PM
To: Zhang, Daniel (Current); Lewis, Larry M (Current)
Cc: Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect); Welch, Mike J (Current); Cooper, Rob R (Current); Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect); Zhang, Xin (Northern Lights); Ding, Li (Northern Lights); Hu, Qian Li (Northern Lights); Wang, Zhong Xin (Northern Lights)
Subject: RE: Deluxe Envelopes - CMFG-39 and subtasks
Importance: High

 

Attach ChecksShipStatusRecordFormat document, you also can find it here http://ctdevsource:8080/secure/attachment/19997/ChecksShipStatusRecFormat.xls

 

Thanks,

Baker Wang

 

From: Wang, Bai Kang (Northern Lights)
Sent: Friday, September 06, 2013 11:21 AM
To: Zhang, Daniel (Current); Lewis, Larry M (Current)
Cc: Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect); Welch, Mike J (Current); Cooper, Rob R (Current); Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect); Zhang, Xin (Northern Lights); Ding, Li (Northern Lights); Hu, Qian Li (Northern Lights); Wang, Zhong Xin (Northern Lights)
Subject: RE: Deluxe Envelopes - CMFG-39 and subtasks
Importance: High

 

Hi Daniel,

 

I have fixed 4 but can’t reproduce CMFG-1145 and CMFG-1141.

 

CMFG-1145:

According to original “Checks Ship Status Record Format” I can’t reproduce, refer to the attachment. If there are changes please provide me latest one.

 

CMFG-1141:

Talked with Li, this bug is out of Converter program control. The Exception message will be sent by PZM system, if there is no error message in Exception, it maybe something happened in PZM system. So to reproduce it I need test data or test environment (where occurs error) and go through PZM process.

 

Thanks,

Baker Wang

 

From: Zhang, Daniel (Current)
Sent: Friday, September 06, 2013 4:59 AM
To: Wang, Bai Kang (Northern Lights); Zhang, Xin (Northern Lights); Ding, Li (Northern Lights); Hu, Qian Li (Northern Lights); Wang, Zhong Xin (Northern Lights)
Cc: Tran, Lam D (PaperDirect); Lewis, Larry M (Current); Welch, Mike J (Current); Cooper, Rob R (Current); Cowan, Lisa L (PaperDirect)
Subject: Deluxe Envelopes - CMFG-39 and subtasks

 

NL PZM Team,

 

We are running out of smaller Deluxe envelopes and we need to switch larger envelopes by now. This urgent business requirement leads Larry to create several more subtasks for CMFG-39.  They are CMFG-1140, CMFG-1141,  CMFG-1145, CMFG-1151, CMFG-1154, and CMFG-1155, which were all assigned to Baker.

 

Business wants them to be code-ready on coming US Monday (9/9/13) so Larry can UAT test them on Monday.  Thus we need entire NL team including Xin and Li to work in the weekend to help Baker to get them done, some of them just easy fix and some need more time. Please split them to the team.

 

Qian Li and Zhongxin, please make arrangement to support NL PZM team to complete these tasks. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us.

 

Thanks a lot!

 

Daniel Zhang | IT Systems Manager | Current USA, Inc.

1005 East Woodmen Road | Colorado Springs, CO 80920

Phone: 719-531-2071 | Fax: 866-408-2308

 Description   
Add "Find Orphans" button for all tabs and dialogs, when clicked shows a list of everything for that table where it is not referenced anywhere else. OK would set IsDeleted to true. Would need to select the ones to mark as IsDeleted. Other option is to add "Orphans" to the Search criteria, but we'd need to change the Filter* stored procedures or create a new stored procedure to get that list.

Enh - Data Manager Refactor - Purge Deleted 
Updated: 05/Sep/13 04:01 PM   Created: 31/Jul/13 12:06 AM  

The following issue has been updated.

Updater: Lisa Cowan
Date: 05/Sep/13 04:01 PM

Field Original Value New Value
Change By Lisa Cowan on 05/Sep/13 04:01 PM
Fix Version/s PZMData Manager Next Version

Project: CO Manufacturing
Components: Data Manager

 Description   
Add "Purge Deleted" button for all tabs and dialogs, when clicked shows a list of everything for that table where IsDeleted = 1 and where the it is not referenced anywhere else. OK would do a physical delete of the rows, Cancel would leave them alone. Would need to select the ones to physically delete. Other option is to add a right-click menu to the grid, if IsDeleted = 1 let them try to do a physical delete, the database will return an error if it is referenced anywhere else.

Hi Team,
I will take a vacation to visit my parents from 9/6 to 9/22. I need your help to take care of things when I am out of office.
1. PZM Manufacturing: Mike please lead the team to address development issues. Dev team will have only three developers at that time. Lisa you can coordinate with Mike and Larry for the status update and Jira assignment. Mike please lead daily scrum meetings.
2. PZM QA: Mike and Larry please help to assign Jiras to Cebu team and Michael David after code is done. Please review their EOD report and help answer their questions and assign tasks. Larry please lead daily scrum meeting if needed.
3. Ecommerce sites: I’ll try my best to attend our weekly meeting with NL and help the communication. Qian Li please help with PD/IA and RAL steady state if needed. For any release, Monica can help QA testing for our brands websites. Lisa is PM for steady state sites. Cebu team will QA YouFramecanvas site and other sites.
4. Alloy tickets: Qian Li, Hong Liang and Lin please take care of PD/IA and RAL tickets when you receive them. If it is related to Lillian Vernon, Colorful Images and Current Catalog, please pass to Vanessa Apodaca who will create ticket to ML who maintained LV, CC, and CI sites. When the requests are sent in during US daytime, the persons in the group list please take care of the ticket requests as soon as possible.
5. Production Stop: If you have production stop issues, please call NL team if needed.
Qian Li 011-86 -13820359333 and Qian Li will call developers who are responsible for the sites respectively.
6. McAfee security scan: If you need PCI or security scan for a website, please send request to Scotty Higginbotham who can help you.
7. Order Kickouts: Monica please coordinate with CAC, Kimbrough, and Nancy. Sometimes restarting Pixami service works.
8. PO Portal: Final UAT. Once passed, Lin please ask Jon, Kimbrough, and Andrew to help deploy to live.
9. NDS and other services: Neil please send request to Lin Qi and CC’d to Qianli Hu if you need anything to complete your BRD. Lin please send email to the group if you have road blocker.
I will check my email as much as I can when I am in China and you can call me at 719-964-3894 if it is an emergency. I’ll also keep my skype (daniel.zhang125) available as much as possible.
Thanks for your help!
Daniel Zhang | IT Systems Manager | Current USA, Inc.
1005 East Woodmen Road | Colorado Springs, CO 80920
Phone: 719-531-2071 | Fax: 866-408-2308

Enh - Remove Leading Zeroes on Order Number 
Updated: 05/Sep/13 10:59 AM   Created: 05/Sep/13 10:48 AM  

The following issue has been updated.

Updater: Larry Lewis
Date: 05/Sep/13 10:59 AM

Field Original Value New Value
Change By Larry Lewis on 05/Sep/13 10:59 AM
Description When converting the ICSM Classic input file for Deluxe drop the leading zeroes for the order number
HDR01001000000102747410 order number is 13 positions with 4 leading zeroes, we only need the last 9 digits
instead of 0000102747410, order number is 102747410

This will also allow the correct alignment of the output record by treating the order number as text and doing a left justification in the SHP05 record
         

Project: CO Manufacturing

 Description   
When converting the ICSM Classic input file for Deluxe drop the leading zeroes for the order number
HDR01001000000102747410 order number is 13 positions with 4 leading zeroes, we only need the last 9 digits
instead of 0000102747410, order number is 102747410

This will also allow the correct alignment of the output record by treating the order number as text and doing a left justification in the SHP05 record
